argument.name: colName
argument.description: The name of the UX control to validate.

argument.name: rowNum
argument.description: The row number. In a UX Component, the row number is always '1'. Always pass in a value of *[js:1]* when calling this method.

argument.name: instNum
argument.description: The Repeating Section instance number for the control. This argument is required if the control is in a Repeating Section.

page.description: Executes client-side validation for a control in the UX Component.

discussion.p: The *[js:{dialog.object}.clientSideValidateField()]* method executes client-side validation rules for a control in the UX Component. This method can be used to evaluate the client-side rules on demand using JavaScript. For example:

description.p: To learn more, watch the video below.

When you define validation rules for controls in a UX component, the rule are evaluated when the data is submitted. There are instances where you need to evaluate the validation rules for a set of controls on demand. For example, before navigating to a new Panel Card.

This video demonstrates how to use the {dialog.object}.clientSideValidateField() method to execute client-side validation rules for a set of text boxes when the user tries to navigate to a new Panel Card.
